Sandeep M. Nayak, MD, is an Assistant Professor of Psychiatry at Johns Hopkins and Medical Director of the Center for Psychedelic & Consciousness Research. He joined the center in 2020, completed a postdoctoral fellowship with Roland Griffiths, PhD, and then transitioned to faculty.

Sandeep is currently Principal Investigator of three clinical trials:

-   [BIPOD](https://hopkinspsychedelic.org/opioiduse): a randomized trial of psilocybin for Opioid Use Disorder alongside buprenorphine

-   [Pilot study of psilocybin for PTSD](https://hopkinspsychedelic.org/ptsdstudy)

-   [Microdose psilocybin safety study](https://hopkinspsychedelic.org/microdose) in healthy volunteers

His interests clinical applications of psychedelics, Bayesian statistics, clinical-trial methodology, belief change, and psychedelic anthropology. He is also a practicing psychiatrist.
